scenarioDescription:
The PH2 Exoplanetary System


Overview

PH2 is a star with 0.94 times the mass of the Sun, and 1 times its radius. It is located 1121.53 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2.04 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

PH2 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the PH2 system


PH2 b

PH2 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2013-10, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.83 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of PH2 b is 25440.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of PH2 b is 10.120 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, PH2 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system PH2, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Kepler.
name: PH2 - System With 1 Exoplanet
